edu.purdue.jsysnet.ui.layout
Class ClusteredLayout

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.ics.jung.algorithms.layout.AbstractLayout<V,E>
      edu.purdue.jsysnet.ui.layout.RandomLayout<Molecule,Correlation>
          edu.purdue.jsysnet.ui.layout.ClusteredLayout
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.uci.ics.jung.algorithms.layout.Layout<Molecule,Correlation>, org.apache.commons.collections15.Transformer<Molecule,Point2D>
public class ClusteredLayout
extends RandomLayout<Molecule,Correlation>

A JUNG Graph Layout which clusters molecules that are closely correlated together and separates those which are not.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas McGrew

getRepulsion

protected double getRepulsion(Molecule v1,
                              Molecule v2)
Returns the repulsion force between 2 vertices. In the default implementation this is a constant.

Parameters:
v1 - The first vertex.
v2 - The second vertex.
Returns:
The repulsion force between two vertices.

getOptimum

protected double getOptimum(Molecule v1,
                            Molecule v2)
Returns the optimum distance for 2 vertices. Ideally this should be between 0 and 1, where 1 equals the minimum of the height and width of the layout. Normally this is repulsion minus attraction, but this method can be overriden if desired.

Parameters:
v1 - The first vertex.
v2 - The second vertex.
Returns:
The optimum distance for the 2 vertices.
